Dear Kathleen Suzanne Sperling:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
11/30/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at .
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
(6) An agency shall do all of the following:
(c) Provide a copy of the report to any social services
w orker tha has children placed in the home.
Two of the three special evaluations reviewed did not include adequate
documentation that the social worker with children in the home was given a copy of
the completed special evaluation report.
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
(7) If any violations are cited and there is a signed
corrective action plan, all social service workers who
have children placed in the home must be notified there
is a corrective action plan and what is required of the
foster parent in that plan.
Two of the three special evaluations reviewed resulted in the need for a corrective
action plan. There was inadequate documentation to confirm the social service
worker with children in the home was given a copy of the corrective action plan as
required by this rule.

VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. The
agency submitted a corrective action plan for the renewal evaluation completed
09/26/2022. The only noncompliance identified as a part of the renewal evaluation
was Rule 400.12327 (5)(d). The CAP was approved 10/30/2023 and there were
no repeat violations identified as a part of this interim evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment included a review of the agency's
assessment of their compliance with the corrective action plan associated with the
renewal evaluation. Their review of this process indicated compliance had been
achieved and the ongoing process was in place to maintain compliance
associated with the one citation.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff and Youth Interviews
Child Welfare Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. No concerns
were identified.
Youth interviews with the analyst were positive in nature and indicated appropriate
support services are being provided.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is well maintained, and record storage is consistent with compliance
with licensing requirements.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The analyst identified one safety alert involving a relative home. The home was in
need of a new smoke detector on the second floor. A new detector was installed,
and documentation of compliance was received and accepted/approved. Interviews
3

with caregivers and foster children were positive and indicated appropriate support
services are being provided.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
